cyclone.name: HAROLD
cyclone.current_location: about 480 miles ESE of Port Mansfield, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving quickly westward toward the south-central Texas coast (mouth of the Rio Grande to Port O’Connor) and then inland across south Texas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south Texas coast near Baffin Bay-Corpus Christi area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Port O'Connor to Sargent, TX (tropical-storm watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Rio Grande to Port O'Connor, TX (tropical-storm warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Texas shoreline from the Rio Grande northward to Sargent, TX
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts 25–30 mph possible; sustained tropical-storm-force winds unlikely
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tide rise below 1 ft; significant surge not expected north of Sargent
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of rain may bring 1–2 inches with localized higher totals, but widespread heavy rain not expected
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough surf and dangerous rip currents along the upper Texas coast
